summary: Gukesh D, an 18-year-old Indian chess prodigy, has become the youngest World Chess Champion, defeating Ding Liren in a dramatic 14-game match in Singapore. This victory makes Gukesh the second World Champion from India after Viswanathan Anand, marking the peak of his accomplished career, which includes becoming a grandmaster at age 12 and winning the Candidates. Despite criticism from some, including Magnus Carlsen, Gukesh remains unfazed and attributes his success to his mental strength and unwavering mindset.
